result.execSummary:
All charges against Isaac Paul Kauffmann in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Isaac Paul Kauffmann is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac Paul Kauffmann

defendant.name: Kauffmann, Isaac Paul
defendant.address: 217 S. Piety Street Apt. B, Ellsworth, WI 54011

records.addlTxt: 2:40 PM Defendant Isaac Paul Kauffmann in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Isaac Paul Kauffmann.  Attorney Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF25, 22CF44 and 22CF195. ADA walker: guilty to Ct#1 in 22CF25 w/ 2 years DJOC. guilty to Ct#2 in 22CF25 without repeater enhancer 2 years probation w/ court costs ($543) restitution $128 plus 10% surcharge. Dismiss 22CF44. guilty to Ct#3 in 22CF195 w/1 year probation: court costs ($543).Atty Nelson and Def agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights  Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 w/out repeater enhancer in 22CF25 and Ct#3 in 22Cf195. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Def guilty of Ct#1 and Ct#2 w/o repeater enhancer in 22CF25 and guilty to Ct#3 in 22CF195, dismiss 22CF44 and Ct#1-2 in 22CF195. ADA Walker and Atty Nelson address sentencing. Court orders S/W 2 years probation on Ct#2 in 22CF25; court costs ($543), $128 restitution w/ 10% surcharge. Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 4 days credit if probation is revoked.  Court orders S/W 1 year probation Ct#3 in 22CF195: court costs ($543), Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 0 days credit. Court withholds judgment of conviction in favor of the 2 year DJOC on Ct#1 in 22CF25. Court approves the terms/conditions of the DJOC. Defendant to report to probation today. Defendant to remain until handed a signed copy of the DJOC .Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 3:09

03:44 PM Defendant Isaac Paul Kauffmann in Court with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CF25 & 22CF44.  Attorneys request plea date, Court sets.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing on September 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

11:30 AM Defendant Isaac Paul Kauffmann appears in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF44 and 22CF25. Atty Nelson would like to set a plea date with the Judge. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 11:33 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on June 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the information. NG. Court adjourned at 2:07 pm.

2:00 PM Defendant Isaac Paul Kauffmann appears in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF25 and 22CF44 (PH). Atty Nelson and DE would like to waive the PH's. Court questions DE. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:01 PM Defendant Isaac Paul Kauffmann appears in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF25 and 22CF44 (STC). ADA Walker states the cases need a PH in both cases. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:02 pm  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

from SPD requesting the preliminary hearing be continued to determine eligibility and Defendant is entering treatment today.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
No possession or consumption of alcohol.
Def from PCJ

3:39 PM Defendant Isaac Paul Kauffmann appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Shelly Tomtschik appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. DE does now qualify for PD.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS & no consumption of alcohol, no objection. Court so orders.  DE to send confirmation on treatment to PD so he can get the PH's reset. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:47 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
